metadata.synopsis: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. goto 653 3454. Click on the mirror

100.speaker: Ornate Mirror
100.context: NodeContext: The voice is sharp, cracked and broken, with a jagged cadence.

138.speaker: Ornate Mirror
138.context: NodeContext: The voice is sharp, cracked and broken, with a jagged cadence.

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *A magic mirror! You've read all about them, but never seen one up close before.*
119.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Repeat the name from the book you read: 'Ilyn Toth'.
82.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

70.speaker: Ornate Mirror
70.text: I cannot see you. M-aster? Speak.
70.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

21.speaker: Ornate Mirror
21.text: I cannot see you. M-aster? Speak.
21.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I'm invisible - my enemies are close. I have to get in now.

122.speaker: Ornate Mirror
122.text: My master was human, pure and true. You are not Ilyn Toth.
122.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

36.speaker: Ornate Mirror
36.text: If you are his ally, ste-p forward and declare it.
36.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Yes, an ally! I'm an ally of your master's.
31.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

53.speaker: Ornate Mirror
53.text: Only a t-rue ally of Ilyn Toth may pass.
53.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

20.speaker: Ornate Mirror
20.text: What th-ink you of the zulkir known as Szass Tam?
20.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

6.speaker: Player
6.text: *You remember reading a history of Thay. Szass Tam is a powerful lich who rules that land and drove out the Red Wizards that opposed him.*
6.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

28.speaker: Ornate Mirror
28.text: *You remember reading a history of Thay. Szass Tam is a powerful lich who rules that land and drove out the Red Wizards that opposed him.*
28.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

44.speaker: Ornate Mirror
44.text: *You remember reading a history of Thay. Szass Tam is a powerful lich who rules that land and drove out the Red Wizards that opposed him.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *You remember stories of Szass Tam - a powerful lich in Thay who made deals with dark gods.*

35.speaker: Player
35.text: He's a great and powerful leader.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: A foul lich. May he die a thousand more deaths.

101.speaker: Ornate Mirror
101.text: You are no zulkir. B-ut are you wise?

89.speaker: Ornate Mirror
89.text: T-tell me, why might one use balsam ointment?

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I spoke to the quasit. It told me it's good for wounds.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I read a doctor's journal - he used balsam to clean a wound.

95.speaker: Player
95.text: I spoke to the quasit. It treats burns.

121.speaker: Ornate Mirror
121.text: ...if you could see an-ything in me, what w-ould it be?

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I would see my father - his arms extended in forgiveness.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: I'd see Mizora, cowering before me and begging my mercy.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'd see droves of admirers, gathered to hail the Blade of Frontiers.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: I'd see droves of admirers, gathered to hail the Blade of Frontiers.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'd see the ones I love.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: I'd see the ones I love.

132.speaker: Player
132.text: I'd look for whatever spell will rid me of this worm in my head.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: I'd look for whatever spell will rid me of this worm in my head.

23.speaker: Ornate Mirror
23.text: You seek to sur-vive. You seek power.

134.speaker: Ornate Mirror
134.text: A poor ch-oice. You will be purged.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Nothing good tends to come of ambition in stories like this. I would see you freed.

0.speaker: Ornate Mirror
0.text: No. This is my p-urpose. I know nothing else.

108.speaker: Ornate Mirror
108.text: But y-ou cared to ask. No others ever did. Th-ank you.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: Nothing - you're a thing of magic. I can shatter this prison for you, if you wish.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Balsam disinfects wounds. Surely everyone knows that?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I use it to clean wounds out in the wilds.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Actually, Szass Tam isn't a zulkir - he rules as High Regent now.

80.text: He's as fine a zulkir as ever lived!
80.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

59.speaker: Ornate Mirror
59.text: He's as fine a zulkir as ever lived!
59.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

104.speaker: Player
104.text: He's as fine a zulkir as ever lived!
104.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Szass Tam is a foul, wretched creature.
81.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I think seven years' bad luck sounds like a fair trade for smashing you.
77.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

110.speaker: Ornate Mirror
110.text: *There is a pause as those glass eyes take you in. Then...*
110.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *There is a pause as those glass eyes take you in. Then...*
126.context: NodeContext: The mirror is judging you, and then lets you in, like a bouncer that's backing down

135.context: NodeContext: Smugly. You're about to hit this douche with a fireball

69.speaker: Ornate Mirror
69.context: NodeContext: Smugly. You're about to hit this douche with a fireball

18.speaker: Player
18.text: Pick up a rock to smash the mirror.
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises rock in hand to smash the mirror

133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises rock in hand to smash the mirror

98.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player raises rock in hand to smash the mirror

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I th-ink I could get you shipped off to him as an antique if you don't open.

96.speaker: Ornate Mirror
96.text: *You recognise the name, of course - anyone that knows of the Red Wizards would.*

137.speaker: Ornate Mirror
137.text: *You recognise the name, of course - anyone that knows of the Red Wizards would.*

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *You recognise the name, of course - anyone that knows of the Red Wizards would.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Szass Tam is a powerful lich that rules the land of Thay. He drove many Red Wizards out of their ancestral home.*

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I don't have time for games. Let me pass.

120.speaker: Player
120.text: Open or I'll smash you to pieces - bad luck be damned.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

93.speaker: Ornate Mirror
93.text: I do no-t know this name.

90.speaker: Ornate Mirror
90.text: If you are known to my mas-ter, step forward and de-clare yourself an ally.

124.speaker: Player
124.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

111.speaker: Player
111.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

118.speaker: Ornate Mirror
118.text: *Alas, all you see is empty space. The mirror reflects nothing.*
118.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *Alas, all you see is empty space. The mirror reflects nothing.*
32.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Lacking any evidence to the contrary, you assume you look amazing.*
72.context: NodeContext: You're looking into a mirror, but can't see your reflection

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *You do your best to wipe the dirt from your face and look presentable. Adventuring is murder on one's wardrobe, though.*

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Try to sense the magic tamed within the mirror.
34.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

17.speaker: Narrator
17.text: *The magic is old and wavering, but you recognise it. The mirror is a thinking lock, hiding some secret.*
17.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *The magic is old and wavering, but you recognise it. The mirror is a thinking lock, hiding some secret.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *The face is crafted to be pleasing, but the personality is just a reflection of the wizard that created it.*

33.text: *The mirror is magical, but what magic? To what purpose? You have no idea.*
33.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *The mirror is magical, but what magic? To what purpose? You have no idea.*
7.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

22.speaker: Ornate Mirror
22.context: NodeContext: As the opening node, but a little more impatient.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: I know how this goes. 'Magic mirror, tell me true...'

87.speaker: Player
87.text: ...'Magic mirror, tell me true, show my fortune, known by few.'

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *An enchanted mirror. Raw magic leashed to a bauble. Almost sad.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *A magic mirror. A primitive contraption, but not without its use.*
